rich-page.field:
Guide

Here you can find information about this template's structure, how it works and how to use it effectively.

System Validation Qualification Kit

This template was created to offer support for the Software Tool qualification process for medical devices.  The process outlined is driven from Clause 11: Confidence in The Use of Software Tools of ISO 26262 - Part 8: Supporting Processes, and United States FDA guidance on non-product software validation.

Clause 11 specifies that software workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top  utilized to develop safety-related elements must be assessed for their potential to contribute to the Functional Safety risk, using a framework governing the qualification of such workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top . (Either individually or in combination with other workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top that make up a " workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top " irrespective of whether the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top in the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top are utilized individually as standalone processes and/or are integrated together.)

The First Objective is to provide the criteria needed to determine a software workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top Level of Confidence.

The Second Objective is to provide the ways and means for the qualification of a software workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and provide evidence that the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top is suitable for use in development activities or tasks, (i.e. users can be assured that the software tool functions correctly for its intended uses.) 

The Structure

This template uses several types of objects to effectively qualify any workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in a workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top . The backbone of the process is the combined use of workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top - workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top Work Items.

Each of these Work Items make use of a supporting  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document that renders the information available from a linked set of Work Items and contains additional information using the embedded workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top - workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item pairs.

workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top also links to a documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document containing the workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top needed to qualify all workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top .

Likewise workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top links to a documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document, that contains the workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top used to validate the workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top . A testing/testrun-type manual false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Test Run that selects  workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top   testrun-selectTestCasesBy dynamicLiveDoc false true false true true true true <b>" "</b> _top is used to perform the actual validation.

The Qualification Process

The Qualification process consists of three major phases:

1 Preparation

The first task is to create a structure that contains the objects needed to complete the qualification.

  • Every qualification process starts by creating a  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item and entering its "Title".
    • NOTE: workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in the context of this template represents a unique composition of software programs specified by their Tool Version, Environment and by Qualification workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Methods</b> _top  used for the qualification. If any of these parameters change, you need to create a new  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top , reuse the already available data from former qualifications, modify the changed parts and conduct a new qualification.
      • i.e. there must be two separate  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top for qualifying Polarion ALM 2016 and Polarion ALM 2017.
    • NOTE: workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top houses all qualifications and must be created,  even when only qualifying a single workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • When a new  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top is created, a Tool Chain Qualification Report  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document is automatically created and linked to the  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • Save the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • Set an "Assignee(s)", select the "Target RPL" and set the "Status" of the  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top to  toolchain status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
      • NOTE: The Target RPL for the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top should have already been established in previous steps of the certification process.
    • For every  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top either:
      • Link an already completed workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top qualification with the same Tool Version, Environment and Qualification workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Methods</b> _top to the  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
      • OR Create a new workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top as a child of the  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top with the "is part of the tool chain" role, enter a "Title", select a "Tool Type", a "Tool Version", an "Environment" and:
        • If there is already an existing  documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document for the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top , select it in the "Use Case Specification" custom field and it will be used instead of creating a new empty Document from the basic template.
        • If there is an existing Tool Qualification Report  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document for the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top more applicable than the basic empty template, select it in the "Qualification Report" custom field and it will be reused for the new Report and linked with the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .  You can then edit and tailor this Report specifically for the new workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
        • Complete the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top validation questionnaire in order to establish the basis for determining the tool TCL, and therefore Qualification workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Methods</b> _top .
        • Save the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
        • Set an "Assignee(s)", fill in the "Environment Details" and "Configuration Settings", and set "Tool Impact" and "Tool Error Detection" levels. Select "RPL", calculate an "Initial Estimate" and set the "Status" of the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top to  tool status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
          • NOTE: The Tool Confidence Level is automatically calculated when the Work Item is saved, based on the Tool Impact and Tool Error Detection selections.
          • NOTE: The RPL for the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top should have already been established in previous steps of the certification process.
          • NOTE:  The pre-mitigation RPL for affected product should be used if the software validation is one of the process mitigations used to control the product Hazardous Situation.  The post-mitigation values may be used if the software validation is not used as a mitigation to control the product Hazardous Situation.
          • NOTE: The RPL of each workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in a  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top must be equal to or lower than the Target RPL of the associated  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top . Any violations of this rule appear in the Tool Chain Qualification Report  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document.
        • For all  workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top ,  workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top and workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Qualification Methods</b> _top  used to qualify the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top :
          • Create a new workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top as a child of the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top , enter a "Title" and:
            • If there is an existing Method Qualification Report  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document for the Method more applicable than the basic empty template, select it in the "Qualification Method" custom field and it will be reused for the new Report and linked with the Method. This Report can be customized to specifically match the new Method.
            • Save the Method.
            • Set an "Assignee(s)", calculate an "Initial Estimate" and set the "Status" of the  workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top to  metConfidenceFromUse status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
        • For the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top :
          • Create a new workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method </b> _top as a child of the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top , enter a "Title" and:
            • If there is already an existing  documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document for the  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top , select it in the "Test Case Specification" custom field and it will be used instead of creating a new empty Document from the basic template.
            • If there is an existing Method Qualification Report  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document for the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method </b> _top  more applicable than the basic empty template, select it in the "Qualification Method" custom field and it will be reused for the new Report and linked with the Method. You can then edit and tailor this Report specifically for the new Method.
            • When a new  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top is created, a testing/testrun-type manual false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Test Run that selects  workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top   testrun-selectTestCasesBy dynamicLiveDoc false true false true true true true " " _top is automatically created, configured and linked to the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top .
            • Save the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method </b> _top
            • Set an "Assignee(s)", Calculate an "Initial Estimate" and set the "Status" of the  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top to  metValidationOfTool status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
        • NOTE: Strongly Recommended Qualification Methods (SRQMs) for a  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top are calculated based on the Tool Confidence Level and RPL.
        • NOTE: If you decide to use a Not Strongly Recommended Qualification Method, indicate this by checking the Method's "Ignore "NSRM" Warning" custom field. The potential Incorrect use of Qualification Methods is highlighted in part 4.3-6 of the Tool Qualification Report  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document.

Image 1: All possible objects present after the Preparation phase.

2 Execution

In this phase, gather and process all qualification data. All objects, if present, must be in the following states to complete the phase.  

  • Work Items -  toolchain status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top or status verified-rejected false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top
    • Applies for workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top , workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top and workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Methods</b> _top .
  • Documents -  documents/document-status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top  
    • Applies for documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
  • Test Runs -  testing/testrun-status verifiedPassed false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top or testing/testrun-status verifiedFailed false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top
    • Applies for Use Case Acceptance Tests.

Data entry can be managed by multiple people in parallel and the steps below can be executed in any order. Completing this phase for the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top level requires that all the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top within it have been completed first. Start by setting the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and the  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top   documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document to documents/document-status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and then complete the phase for all workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top .

A generic example for qualifying a single workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top is as follows:

  • Because there is a lot of automation in the documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Documents, (the data gets loaded from the linked Work Items, Test Runs and other Documents), the qualification process progresses by analyzing the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and preparing a set of workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top in the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top   documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document.
    • Start by setting the "Status" of the documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document to documents/document-status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • NOTE: The workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top should be split into themed groups. (i. e. Administration, Basic Use, Advanced Features...)
    • NOTE: Each workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top should have a "Subtype, "Categories" and a "Description" filled-in.
    • All the workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top in the documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document should be usecase status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top before moving the Document into the documents/document-status done false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top state.
  • If the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top is used:
    • For every workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in the  workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top   documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document, there should be at least one workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method's</b> _top documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document.
      • Start by setting the "Status" of the  documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document to documents/document-status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
      • NOTE: The workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top should be split into themed groups using Headings. (i. e. Administration, Basic Use, Advanced Features...)
      • Each workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top should have a "Test Type", "Categories", a "Description" and "Test Steps" filled-in.
      • Each workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top must be linked to a single workitem-type usecase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top  with the workitem-link-role verifies false true false true true true true "<b> "</b> _top link role.
      • All the workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top in the documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top  should be testcase status active false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top  or testcase status inactive false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top before moving the Document into the documents/document-status done false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top state.
    • The workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method's</b> _top Test Run must be executed.
      • NOTE: The Test Run is pre-configured to run all workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top contained in the workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> Method's</b> _top documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document.
      • Start by setting the "Status" of the Test Run to testing/testrun-status inProgress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
      • Click on "Execute Test" do the following for each workitem-type testcase false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top :
        • Scroll to the "Execute Test" form extension, 
        • Click "Start Test Case",
        • Complete all Test Steps, enter an Actual Result and select the "Verdict" step, 
        • Enter the Test Case Verdict and select if it "Passed", "Failed" or was "Blocked",
        • Complete the execution by creating a Signature.
      • Return to the Test Run and change its "Status" to  testing/testrun-status passed false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top or  testing/testrun-status failed false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top based on the Results and confirm the status change with a Signature.
      • If a Test Case Fails, an workitem-type exception false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top is created.
        • Each workitem-type exception false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top must be addressed and either  exception status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top or  exception status verified-rejected false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
  • The next step is to complete all the documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Documents.
    • NOTE: Each workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top has a single documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document linked to it.
    • NOTE: documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Documents and/or their  workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Items can use an  workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item to link external data to it.
      • workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top can be associated with multiple workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Items.
      • Each workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item can store three types of data:
        • A text string in the "Reference" custom field,
        • Internal or external hyperlinks in the Hyperlinks section,
        • Attachments in the Attachments section.
    • Start by setting the "Status" of the  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document to documents/document-status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • Go through all workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Items.
      • If it is information status automated false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top :
        • Check the validity of the rendered data.
        • (Optional). Add a response or select the relevant  workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item(s).  
      • If it is information status manual false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top :
        • Change its state to information status inprogress false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top ,
        • Enter a "Response" and select the relevant  workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item(s).
        • Mark the Work Item as information status done false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top , review them a final time, then mark them as information status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • (Optional) Add new  workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Items to store additional, non-standardized information, in the Document.
    • Address any automated warnings within the Document.
    • Set the  documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top to  documents/document-status done false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
    • Set the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top to metConfidenceFromUse status resolved false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top or the workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Methods</b> _top to  metConfidenceFromUse status done false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top .
  • In the final step every Document, Test Run and Work Item needs to be reviewed, signed and set to information status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top to comply with the conditions defined at the top of this chapter.

After the qualification is done for all the workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> s</b> _top , review the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document, set its "Status" to documents/document-status done false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top and set the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top "Status" to toolchain status resolved false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top . To complete the phase do a final review of the results and set the  workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document to  documents/document-status verified false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top then toolchain status verified false true false true true true false <b> Verify</b> _top the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top itself.

Image 2: State of all the possible objects after the Execution phase.

3 Finalization

This last phase is dedicated to exporting the Work Product that can then be supplied to the certification authority for review.

Work Product Contents

Polarion does not yet support bulk Document print/export, so all relevant Documents need to be exported one at a time.

Default Structure

  • workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top   documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document
  • For every workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top in the workitem-type toolchain false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top :
    • documents/document-type use_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document
    • workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document
  • For every workitem-type tool false true false true true true true <b> 's</b> _top workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Method</b> _top :
    • workitem-type metConfidenceFromUse false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metEvaluationOfDevelopment false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true false <b> </b> _top workitem-type metDevelopmentWithStandard false true false true true true false <b> Method's</b> _top   documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document
  • For  workitem-type metValidationOfTool false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top also:
    • documents/document-type test_case_specification false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Document

NOTE: Every documents/document-type qualification_documentation false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top contains workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Items.

  • For every workitem-type information false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item with linked workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item:
    • Data from  workitem-type evidence false true false true true true true <b> </b> _top Work Item
